name: Hereditary Spherocytosis Type 2
chief_complaint: My child is always tired and looks pale, and sometimes their eyes look yellow.
prognosis: Good with proper management, though chronic hemolysis may persist. Splenectomy reduces but doesn't eliminate anemia.
description: An inherited hemolytic anemia caused by defects in red blood cell membrane proteins (typically ankyrin or band 3 mutations), leading to spherical, fragile RBCs that are prematurely destroyed in the spleen. Autosomal dominant inheritance pattern with variable expressivity.
